cards.name: Sandygast
cards.text: It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while they're blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

cards.name: Palossand
cards.text: From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones of its victims, which are all dried up after being drained of their vitality.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

cards.name: Enamorus
cards.text: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

attacks.name: Love Resonance
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon in play are the same type as any of your opponent's Pokémon in play, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Scream Tail ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Scream
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only during your first turn. Your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Munkidori

abilities.name: Adrena-Brain
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached, you may move up to 3 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: Munkidori keeps itself somewhere safe while it toys with its foes, using psychokinesis to induce intense dizziness.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Fezandipiti

abilities.name: Adrena-Pheromone
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached and is damaged by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

cards.text: Fezandipiti beats its glossy wings to scatter pheromones that captivate people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Feather
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Sandshrew
cards.text: No matter how high a place it falls from, this Pokémon can save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Sandslash
cards.text: The spikes on its body are made up of its hardened hide. It rolls up and attacks foes with its spikes.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Hisuian Growlithe
cards.text: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.

attacks.name: Blazing Destruction
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Hisuian Arcanine
cards.text: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.

attacks.name: Proud Fangs
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Nosepass
cards.text: When endangered, it may protect itself by increasing its magnetism and drawing nearby iron objects to its body.

attacks.name: Power Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Probopass
cards.text: Probopass radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances are rendered useless while it's around.

attacks.name: Assault Laser
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Timburr
cards.text: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle heavy lumber without difficulty.

attacks.name: Best Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Gurdurr
cards.text: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 30 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Conkeldurr
cards.text: Rather than rely on their strength, they master moves that make good use of centrifugal force to swing around concrete.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Gutsy Swing
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, ignore all Energy in this attack's cost.

cards.name: Greninja ex
cards.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).,Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Shinobi Blade
attacks.text: You may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Mirage Barrage
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Hawlucha
cards.text: Hawlucha live quietly without flocking together. They fight constantly with their natural enemies: noisy groups of Primeape.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Glimmet
cards.text: Glimmet's toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.

attacks.name: Rock Shot
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Glimmora
cards.text: Glimmora's petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Ting-Lu
cards.text: It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.

attacks.name: Ground Crasher
attacks.text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack also does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, and discard that Stadium. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Okidogi

abilities.name: Adrena-Power
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached, it gets +100 HP, and the attacks it uses do 100 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Okidogi is a ruffian with a short temper. It can pulverize anything by swinging around the chain on its neck.

cards.name: Cornerstone Mask Ogerpon ex

abilities.name: Cornerstone Stance
abilities.text: Prevent all damage from attacks done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon that have an Ability.

cards.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).,Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Demolish
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Poochyena
cards.text: Poochyena pursue their prey in packs. Once the prey is exhausted, the pack finishes it off. But sometimes the prey retaliates, and the pack flees.

attacks.name: Continuous Steps
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Mightyena
cards.text: Once it's caught the scent of faraway prey, the leader gives a signal, and the whole pack moves out.

attacks.name: Hunting Pack
attacks.text: If Mightyena is on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Venipede
cards.text: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Whirlipede
cards.text: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Scolipede
cards.text: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws' toxic spikes.

attacks.name: Dastardly Jab
attacks.text: Put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

cards.name: Brute Bonnet
cards.text: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Relentless Punches
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Skarmory
cards.text: People fashion swords from Skarmory's shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.

attacks.name: Big Storm
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

cards.name: Aron
cards.text: It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks— to build up the steel armor that protects its body.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Lairon
cards.text: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.

attacks.name: Steel Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Aggron
cards.text: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.

attacks.name: Angry Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 50 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Heatran

abilities.name: Incandescent Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.text: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

attacks.name: Steel Burst
attacks.text: Discard all Metal Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Varoom
cards.text: The steel section is Varoom's actual body. This Pokémon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.

attacks.name: Metal Coating
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Metal Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Revavroom
cards.text: Revavroom viciously threatens others with the sound of its exhaust. It sticks its tongue out from its cylindrical mouth and sprays toxic fluids.

attacks.name: Rally Back
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Running Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Applin
cards.text: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Dipplin
cards.text: The head sticking out belongs to the fore-wyrm, while the tail belongs to the core-wyrm. The two share one apple and help each other out.

attacks.name: Syrup Catcher
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. This attack does 70 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Dreepy
cards.text: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesn't feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.

cards.name: Drakloak

abilities.name: Recon Directive
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

cards.text: This Pokémon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until they're all grown up.

cards.name: Dragapult ex
cards.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).,Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.,Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Phantom Dive
attacks.text: Put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Tatsugiri

abilities.name: Attract Customers
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal a Supporter card you find there, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.text: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.

cards.name: Farfetch'd

abilities.name: Impromptu Carrier
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

attacks.name: Mach Cut
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Chansey
cards.text: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.

attacks.name: Lucky Attachment
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Blissey ex

abilities.name: Happy Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may move a Basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Snorlax
cards.text: Its stomach's digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. Eating things off the ground doesn't bother it at all.

attacks.name: But First, Food
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Aipom
cards.text: Its tail moves with greater dexterity than its hands. Making deft use of this tail, Aipom lives high among the treetops.

cards.name: Ambipom

abilities.name: Wicked Tail
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

cards.text: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things that Ambipom rarely uses its hands.

cards.name: Ducklett
cards.text: It strengthens its body by diving into the depths of ponds, swimming around while looking for bog moss to eat.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Swanna
cards.text: It's said that many artists have taken inspiration from the sight of a Swanna performing a beautiful dance in the light of dawn.

attacks.name: Fighting Wings
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Bloodmoon Ursaluna ex

abilities.name: Seasoned Skill
abilities.text: Blood Moon used by this Pokémon costs Colorless less for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal up to 2 in any combination of Grass Pokémon and Basic Grass Energy cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.text: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way and if Community Center is in play, shuffle this Caretaker into your deck instead of discarding it.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.text: If you go first, you may use this card during your first turn.    Discard your hand and draw 5 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.text: Once during each player's turn, if they played a Supporter card from their hand this turn, they may heal 10 damage from each of their Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.,You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it into the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

cards.text: Heal 70 damage from your Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.text: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

Put it into the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

cards.name: Handheld Fan
cards.text: If the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), move an Energy from the Attacking Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.,You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. cards.text: You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.,Search your deck for up to 3 Stage 1 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. cards.text: Pokémon Tools attached to each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) have no effect.,You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it into the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

cards.text: Choose 1:    • Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.  • During this turn, attacks used by your Pokémon do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon ex and Active Pokémon V (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.text: Put up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon that don't have a Rule Box and Basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon with the same name as 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Lucian
cards.text: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, each player flips a coin. If heads, that player draws 6 cards. If tails, they draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.text: If the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), draw 2 cards.,You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. cards.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and discard any number of them. Put the other cards back in any order.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.text: You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.,Put 1 of your Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.,ACE SPEC: You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Secret Box
cards.text: You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.,You can use this card only if you discard 3 other cards from your hand.    Search your deck for an Item card, a Pokémon Tool card, a Supporter card, and a Stadium card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.,ACE SPEC: You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.text: You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.,Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.,ACE SPEC: You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Boomerang Energy
cards.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.    If this card is discarded by an effect of an attack used by the Pokémon this card is attached to, attach this card from your discard pile to that Pokémon after attacking.

cards.name: Legacy Energy
cards.text: You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.,As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.    If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card. This effect of your Legacy Energy can't be applied more than once per game.,ACE SPEC: You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Pinsir
cards.text: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.

attacks.name: Slow Crunch
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

cards.name: Sunflora
cards.text: Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always looking in the direction of the sun.

attacks.name: Redirected Sunlight
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Fire Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Dipplin

abilities.name: Festival Lead
abilities.text: If Festival Grounds is in play, this Pokémon may use an attack it has twice. If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.

cards.text: The head sticking out belongs to the fore-wyrm, while the tail belongs to the core-wyrm. The two share one apple and help each other out.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Poltchageist

abilities.name: Storehouse Hideaway
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks from your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon.

cards.text: Poltchageist looks like a regional form of Sinistea, but it was recently discovered that the two Pokémon are entirely unrelated.

cards.name: Torkoal
cards.text: Coal is the source of Torkoal's energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.

attacks.name: Ramming Shell
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Infernape

abilities.name: Pyro Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Fire Energy card, a Basic Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.text: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.

attacks.name: Scorching Fire
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Froslass

abilities.name: Freezing Shroud
abilities.text: During Pokémon Checkup, put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon that has an Ability (both yours and your opponent's), except any Froslass.

cards.text: It freezes prey by blowing its −58 degree Fahrenheit breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.

cards.name: Phione
cards.text: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

attacks.name: Beckon
attacks.text: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Cramorant
cards.text: It's an incredibly poor learner because it uses the bare minimum amount of energy for its brain. It focuses on battling instead.

attacks.name: Spit Shot
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Heliolisk
cards.text: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Wattrel
cards.text: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they're a popular delicacy.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Enamorus
cards.text: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

cards.name: Hisuian Growlithe
cards.text: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.

cards.name: Probopass

cards.name: Timburr

attacks.name: Best Punch

cards.name: Lairon
cards.text: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.

attacks.name: Steel Tackle

cards.name: Applin
cards.text: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.

cards.text: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.
